Posts.Content: Hi ladies from a routine Mammigram, my first one turned 50 in May, I was called for secondary screening. At this appt they told me there was a lump 7mm in right boob. I couldn’t feel it neither could the doctor, although she could see exactly where it was on US screen. Anyway took a biopsy & put in titanium marker, I was told it def wasn’t a cyst & almost def BC. I was given appt there & then for 10 days later, next Monday to meet with consultant & get biopsy results. It’s taken until today for the bruising to be enough that I can have a feel, I can now feel a small lump!! My logical brain tells me this is surely the marker & that it hasn’t grown that significantly in 9 days!!!!  I have been reading lots of your stories & you are a wonderful, kind, strong group of women & in a strange way I’m happy to be part of the club!!!
Posts.Title: Just joined the start line!

Posts.Content: Thank you for your response’s. my friend is taking me, she had a rad hysterectomy 9 years ago for cervical cancer & another friend is joining us, she is an A& E doctor at the same hospital, I think Ive covered all angles. Im very thankful for the screening service, nothing could be seen or felt, so I had no idea there was any problem.  I will probably be back here on Monday when so, hopefully have some info on what next. virtual hugs back at uou xxxx
Posts.Title: Just joined the start line!

Posts.Content: Hi Hope your doing OK, its certainly a roller coaster of a ride!! Im very lucky that I have a friend who is a doctor at the hospital Im attending coming with me and my friend who is taking me had cervical cancer 9 years ago, so between them I think Ive got it covered. Do you have any information on what type/grade etc you have and what further tests, treatment plan is ahead?? Sending big virtual hugs. We got this sister!! XXXX
Posts.Title: Just joined the start line!

Posts.Content: Thank your words of wisdom and the book recommend, I will get a copy. I'm very fortunate that I have an amazing group of friends and supportive family.  I hope your doing OK now. Do you have children, mine are 10 & 14, Ive not said anything to them yet as until I get results tomorrow there is nothing to tell really. Thank you XX
Posts.Title: Just joined the start line!

Posts.Content: I’m waiting for biospsy results & have appt with breast surgery clinic Monday, so I’m not able to offer you any words of wisdom, but I do understand how scary the waiting is & the appt seems like a life time away.  Im sure somebody will be along soon with some words of wisdom for you. We’re all in this together, you’re not alone. Big hugs xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Breast lump - frightened and miserable.

Posts.Content: Im really sorry to hear this, I have no words of advice to offer but I do strongly believe that a healthy diet helps us with our mental well being and general energy levels as do relaxing therapies. Keep fighting this damn disease and remember everybody on here has got your back. XX
Posts.Title: Breast lump - frightened and miserable.
